aria-atomic.description: Indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region based on the change notifications defined by the aria-relevant attribute.

aria-braillelabel.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element, which is intended to be converted into Braille. See related aria-label.

aria-brailleroledescription.description: Defines a human-readable, author-localized abbreviated description for the role of an element, which is intended to be converted into Braille. See related aria-roledescription.

aria-busy.description: Indicates an element is being modified and that assistive technologies MAY want to wait until the modifications are complete before exposing them to the user.

aria-controls.description: Identifies the element (or elements) whose contents or presence are controlled by the current element. See related aria-owns.

tokens.page: Represents the current page within a set of pages.
tokens.step: Represents the current step within a process.
tokens.location: Represents the current location within an environment or context.
tokens.date: Represents the current date within a collection of dates.
tokens.time: Represents the current time within a set of times.
tokens.true: Represents the current item within a set.
tokens.false: Does not represent the current item within a set.

aria-current.description: Indicates the element that represents the current item within a container or set of related elements.

aria-describedby.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object. See related aria-labelledby and aria-description.

aria-details.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that provide additional information related to the object. See related aria-describedby.

aria-disabled.description: Indicates that the element is perceivable but disabled, so it is not editable or otherwise operable. See related aria-hidden and aria-readonly.

tokens.copy: A duplicate of the source object will be dropped into the target.
tokens.execute: A function supported by the drop target is executed, using the drag source as an input.
tokens.link: A reference or shortcut to the dragged object will be created in the target object.
tokens.move: The source object will be removed from its current location and dropped into the target.
tokens.popup: There is a popup menu or dialog that allows the user to choose one of the drag operations.

aria-dropeffect.deprecated: [Deprecated in ARIA 1.1] Indicates what functions can be performed when a dragged object is released on the drop target.
aria-dropeffect.description: This property allows assistive technologies to convey the possible drag options available to users, including whether a pop-up menu of choices is provided by the application.

aria-errormessage.description: Identifies the element that provides an error message for an object. See related aria-invalid and aria-describedby.

aria-flowto.description: Identifies the next element (or elements) in an alternate reading order of content.

tokens.false: Indicates that the element supports being dragged.
tokens.true: Indicates that the element has been "grabbed" for dragging.
tokens.undefined: Indicates that the element does not support being dragged.

aria-grabbed.description: Indicates an element's "grabbed" state in a drag-and-drop operation.

tokens.false: Indicates the element does not have a popup.
tokens.true: Indicates the popup is a menu.
tokens.menu: Indicates the popup is a menu.
tokens.listbox: Indicates the popup is a listbox.
tokens.tree: Indicates the popup is a tree.
tokens.grid: Indicates the popup is a grid.
tokens.dialog: Indicates the popup is a dialog.

aria-haspopup.description: Indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element, such as menu or dialog, that can be triggered by an element.

tokens.false: The element is exposed to the accessibility API as if it was rendered.
tokens.true: The element is hidden from the accessibility API.
tokens.undefined: The element's hidden state is determined by the user agent based on whether it is rendered.

aria-hidden.description: Indicates whether the element is exposed to an accessibility API.

tokens.false: There are no detected errors in the value.
tokens.true: The value entered by the user has failed validation.

aria-invalid.description: Indicates the entered value does not conform to the format expected by the application. See related aria-errormessage.

aria-keyshortcuts.description: Indicates keyboard shortcuts that an author has implemented to activate or give focus to an element.

aria-label.description: Defines a string value that labels the current element.

aria-labelledby.description: Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element.

tokens.assertive: Indicates that updates to the region have the highest priority and should be presented the user immediately.
tokens.off: Indicates that updates to the region should not be presented to the user unless the user is currently focused on that region.
tokens.polite: Indicates that updates to the region should be presented at the next graceful opportunity

aria-live.description: Indicates that an element will be updated, and describes the types of updates the user agents, assistive technologies, and user can expect from the live region.

aria-owns.description: Identifies an element (or elements) in order to define a visual, functional, or contextual parent/child relationship between DOM elements

tokens.additions: Element nodes are added to the accessibility tree within the live region.
tokens.additions text: Equivalent to the combination of values, "additions text".
tokens.all: Equivalent to the combination of all values, "additions removals text".
tokens.removals: Text content, a text alternative, or an element node within the live region is removed from the accessibility tree.
tokens.text: Text content or a text alternative is added to any descendant in the accessibility tree of the live region.

aria-relevant.description: Indicates what notifications the user agent will trigger when the accessibility tree within a live region is modified.

aria-roledescription.description: Defines a human-readable, author-localized description for the role of an element.
